con:testCase.name: SML001
con:testCase.con:description: Create Basic Flow B1. Verify that an entry is created in the Service Metadata Locator Service for information relating to the specific participant identifier. Also there is a check that the SMP ID is case insensitive. Verify EDELIVERY-654 is solved.

con:loadTest.name: LoadTest Create Business Identifier

con:testCase.name: SML002
con:testCase.con:description: Create Basic Flow B2, multiple services are exposed by the recipient. Call the function Create with a CreateParticipantIdentifier (which contains the Participant Identifier for a given participant and the identifier of the SMP which holds its data). Ensure that multiple services are exposed by the recipient. Verify that one and only entry is created in the Service Metadata Locator Service for information relating to the specific participant identifier. - Test should succeed (create the participant ID). - Test 1 should fail with BadRequestFault (participant ID already created and linked to another SMP). - Test 2 should fail with BadRequestFault (participant ID already created and linked to another SMP).

con:loadTest.name: LoadTest Create Business Identifier

con:testCase.name: SML003
con:testCase.con:description: Create Error Flow E1, notFoundFault. con:testCase.name: SML005
con:testCase.con:description: Create Error Flow E3, badRequestFault. Call the function Create with a CreateParticipantIdentifier (which contains the Participant Identifier for a given participant and the identifier of the SMP which holds its data). Ensure that the CreateParticipantIdentifier does not contain consistent data. Verify that a Soap Fault badRequestFault is returned. Verify that no entry is created in the Service Metadata Locator Service for information relating to the specific participant identifier. - In "Test" test step, the element "ServiceMetadataPublisherID" is not present. - In "Test 1" test step, the attribute "scheme" name is wrongly set to "schem". - In "Test 2" test step, the attribute "scheme" value contains forbidden caracter "#". - In "Test 3" test step, the SMP ID contains space caracter in the beginning. The SMP ID should be trimmed. Thus, the request should succeed and "Delete Participant 3" is called to re-initialize conditions test for the next steps. - In "Test 4" test step, the SMP ID contains space caracter in the end. The SMP ID should be trimmed. Thus, the request should succeed and "Delete Participant 4" is called to re-initialize conditions test for the next steps. - In "Test 5" test step, the attribute "scheme" value contains forbidden caracter space not in the beginning nor in the end. - In "Test 6" test step, the participant ID contains tab caracter in the beginning. tab is a forbidden caracter: soap fault should be returned. - In "Test 7" test step, the participant ID contains tab caracter in the middle. tab is a forbidden caracter: soap fault should be returned. - In "Test 8" test step, the participant ID contains tab caracter in the end. tab is a forbidden caracter: soap fault should be returned.

con:loadTest.name: LoadTest Create Business Identifier

con:testCase.name: SML008
con:testCase.con:description: CreateList Basic Flow B2, multiple services are exposed by the recipient. Call the function CreateList with a list of Participant Identifiers. (Ensure that multiple services are exposed by the recipient).Verify that one and only entry per Participant Identifiers is created in the Service Metadata Locator Service for information relating to the specific participant identifier. (Regardless of the number of services a recipient exposes, only one record corresponding to the participant identifier is created in the Service Metadata Locator Service by the Service Metadata Publisher which exposes the services for that participant) - Test should succeed (create the participant IDs list). - Test 2 should fail with BadRequestFault (participant ID already created and linked to another SMP). - Test 3 should fail with BadRequestFault (participant ID already created and linked to another SMP).

con:testCase.name: SML011
con:testCase.con:description: CreateList Error Flow E3, badRequestFault. Call the function CreateList with a list of Participant Identifiers. Ensure that the CreateList does not contain consistent data. Verify that a Soap Fault badRequestFault is returned. Verify that no entries are created in the Service Metadata Locator Service for information relating to the specific participant identifiers. - In "Test" test step, the element "ServiceMetadataPublisherID" is not present. - In "Test 1" test step, the attribute "scheme" name is wrongly set to "schem" for 2 participant IDs in the list (in the middle of the list). - In "Test 2" test step, the attributes "scheme" values contain forbidden caracters "#". - In "Test 3" test step, all the participant IDs contain forbidden caracter "-" (according to the scheme). - In "Test 4" test step, one participant ID from the list contains forbidden caracter "-" (according to the scheme). - In "Test 5" test step, one participant ID contains space caracter in the beginning. The participant ID should be trimmed. Thus, the request should succeed and "DeleteList 5" is called to re-initialize conditions test for the next steps. - In "Test 6" test step, the SMP ID contains tab caracter in the beginning. The SMP ID should be trimmed. Thus, the request should succeed and "DeleteList 6" is called to re-initialize conditions test for the next steps. - In "Test 7" test step, the SMP ID contains space caracter in the end. The SMP ID should be trimmed. Thus, the request should succeed and "DeleteList 7" is called to re-initialize conditions test for the next steps. - In "Test 8" test step, the attribute "scheme" name is wrongly set to "schem" for the first participant ID in the list. - In "Test 9" test step, in the request, the number of participant IDs in the list is greater than 100. - In "Test 10" test step, the element "NextPageIdentifier" is present.
con:testCase.con:tearDownScript: // Run clean test steps. testRunner.testCase.testSteps['Delete SMP'].run(testRunner, context);

con:testCase.name: SML059
con:testCase.con:description: WS-I profiles. Verify that all web services bindings in the conform to the relevant WS-I Profiles: - WS-I Basic Profile 1.1 - WS-I Basic Security Profile 1.0

con:config.script: javax.swing.JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Run the WS-I testing tools to verify that all web services bindings in the conform to the relevant WS-I Profiles:\n- WS-I Basic Profile 1.1\n- WS-I Basic Security Profile 1.0.");

con:testCase.name: SML060
con:testCase.con:description: ManageParticipantIdentifier interface binding. Verify that the ManageParticipantIdentifier interface has an HTTP SOAP 1.1 transport binding.

con:config.script: javax.swing.JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Check the WSDL definition to verify the SOAP version:\nVerify that the ManageParticipantIdentifier interface has an HTTP SOAP 1.1 transport binding.");

con:testCase.name: SML061
con:testCase.con:description: ManageParticipantIdentifier transport level security. Verify that the ManageParticipantIdentifier service is secured at the transport level with a two-way SSL / TLS connection and that the requestor authenticates using a client certificate issued for use in the infrastructure by a trusted third-party.

con:config.script: javax.swing.JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Check the security level in the network traces:\nVerify that the ManageParticipantIdentifier service is secured at the transport level with a two-way SSL / TLS connection\nand that the requestor authenticates using a client certificate issued for use in the infrastructure by a trusted third-party.");

con:testCase.name: SML062
con:testCase.con:description: ManageServiceMetadata interface binding. Verify that the ManageServiceMetadata interface has an HTTP SOAP 1.1 transport binding.

con:config.script: javax.swing.JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Check the WSDL definition to verify the SOAP version:\nVerify that the ManageServiceMetadata interface has an HTTP SOAP 1.1 transport binding.");

con:testCase.name: SML063
con:testCase.con:description: ManageServiceMetadata transport level security. Verify that the ManageServiceMetadata service is secured at the transport level with a two-way SSL / TLS connection and that the requestor authenticates using a client certificate issued for use in the infrastructure by a trusted third-party.

con:config.script: javax.swing.JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Check the security level in the network traces:\nVerify that the ManageServiceMetadata service is secured at the transport level with a two-way SSL / TLS connection \nand that the requestor authenticates using a client certificate issued for use in the infrastructure by a trusted third-party.");

con:testCase.name: SML064
con:testCase.con:description: DNSSEC usage. Verify that the SML instance uses the DNSSEC infrastructure for security reasons.

con:config.script: javax.swing.JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Verify that DNSSEC is used by interviewing the developer or checking the code:\nCheck that the SML instance uses the DNSSEC infrastructure for security reasons.");

con:testCase.name: SML065
con:testCase.con:description: Support of old and new PKI infrastructure. Verify that an SMP configured with a certificate from the old PKI infrastructure can read data from the SML that was written with the old PKI infrastructure to the SML.

con:testCase.name: SML066
con:testCase.con:description: PrepareToMigrate, Alternative flow A1, Call the function PrepareToMigrate twice for the same ParticipantIdentifier. Call the function PrepareToMigrate twice (but with a different Migration Key) for the same ParticipantIdentifier with a PrepareMigrationRecord (which contains the Migration Key and the Participant Identifier which is about to be migrated from one SMP to another). The result should be that the Migration Key has been updated to the Migration Key of the second request.
